intro: Sabicea aspera var. velutina, commonly known as the velvety sabicea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Leguminosae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant is distinguished by its dense, velvety pubescence, which gives it its varietal name. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, often in racemes, and may be white or pale yellow. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
